value.ai_summary: This GitHub repository, SolidSample, is an educational project designed to demonstrate and teach the SOLID principles of object-oriented design for C# developers, based on a Pluralsight course by Steve "ardalis" Smith. The repository provides a progressive, step-by-step code example that illustrates how to refactor and improve software design by applying Single Responsibility Principle (SRP), Open-Closed Principle (OCP), Liskov Substitution Principle (LSP), Interface Segregation Principle (ISP), and Dependency Inversion Principle (DIP). Developed using Visual Studio 2019 and targeting .NET developers, the project offers multiple tagged branches representing different stages of implementing SOLID principles, allowing developers to understand and learn how to progressively improve code quality, maintainability, and extensibility. The repository serves as a practical learning resource for software engineers seeking to enhance their understanding of software design principles, with a focus on clean, modular, and flexible C# code architecture. Its unique value lies in its structured, incremental approach to teaching SOLID principles through a hands-on, code-driven methodology, making complex design concepts more accessible and comprehensible for developers at various skill levels.
